content.description: A Fool and His Honey's 5.12a counterpart.  Stickclip the first bolt and start on holds near the arete.  A long, powerful opening sequence subsides at a ledge midway.  Get it all back and finish up with more sustained climbing and an exciting run to the chains
content.location: To the right of A Fool and His Honey

content.description: Tech nine through the first 15 feet to an exciting deadpoint move. Figure out how to get over right to the rest below the roof, then break left into a powerful and fingery crux. Finish up and right on really good stone. One of the best new lines at Invasion.
content.location: First non-red-tagged bolt line left of "A Theory of Gravity". Starts on two low crimps.

content.description: A great route with an awesome finger seam crux.
content.protection: 6 bolts, one of which has a fixed chain. Link anchors.
content.location: On the walk down to the invasion wall proper, look to your right on the dark shaded wall for a bolt line with a chalked up crack up near the top.

content.description: start on the front butt and traverse the rail right into the "5.14". never found the bouldery start to be necessary. neither is the "V10 Dyno". just doa big bump to a letterbox crimp. Move for move it's harder than any other 13c's at Invasion but its literally one hard move at the first clip and a pocket crux halfway up. no endurance needed to climb this route. A Boulders dreams. moves are cool none the less. Joe Kopek uploaded a cool video of the send go on Youtube.
content.protection: fixed as of spring 2020. the tope draws are someones personal ones but they have been there for a min
content.location: Just right of Front Butt. Same start. Stick clip the fixed draw out right.

content.description:
A cool, thin face climb.

 A hard, bouldery start on thin holds leads to a big move and a pumpy, easier rightward traverse. Seems like somewhat creepy fall potential in the easier sections, but everything is safe. Weird anchor clip. Very ledgy at the top.
content.location: After accessing the downhill side of the sex boulder, follow a muddy gully-like trail up the hill on the left side of the boulder, ducking under the classic Ab Lounge boulder. Hot Carl begins right of a broken corner system and a couple other routes with a handful of obvious, chalked up crimps leading to a rightward traversing rail at 1/3 height.

content.description: This link up climbs the best sections of two neighboring routes. Climb through the low crux of "A Fool and his Honey'. After clipping the third bolt (2nd chain draw), traverse left on good holds to a long chain draw. From here head straight up through great rock, making powerful moves on good holds. The crux of the route is just before the chains, so save some juice for the finish.
content.protection: 6 bolts (fixed gear after the first bolt)
content.location: Shares the start (first three bolts) with A Fool and his Honey.

content.description: Shares the start with Filthy Sanchez, but trends right.  Clip the shared bolt to protect the tough traverse out right.  Pull up to gain a rest before the crux.  The obvious sequence will prove more challenging the shorter the climber, but an alternative with less secure feet exists.
content.protection: Bolts to chain (no rings or biners though)
content.location: Starts up the right-facing, detached flake. Trend right after the shared bolt.

content.description: Climbs the arete on the far right hand side of the Southeast face of the Sex Boulder. Weird cruxes.
content.location: Front Butt climbs the arete where the downhill side of the boulder meets the southeast face.

content.description: Climb the obvious line of loose flakes to the top and belay from the tree.
content.location: Just right of the right angling crack "thunder struck".

content.description: Defined (potentially reach-y) crux half way up. Be careful of loose rock & extend the first bolt with a sling if possible.
content.location: Starts on a large right-facing & left-trending flake just in front of a large tree.

content.description:
Starts on Front Butt, then cuts left after a few bolts. 

 Star rating is a guess.

Begin back in the lichen-covered corridor and chimney your way up to the first bolt. After that some easy slab climbing leads to a no hands rest before the crux. Figure out how to climb into the steep roofs and then trend up and left to the chains.
content.protection: 6 bolts (a PITA to clean, recommended to backrope it)
content.location: Right of Twine, start is tucked away in the corridor.

content.description: Steep and imposing, with a hard sequence in the roof.
content.location: Approaching the Sex Boulder, locate the place where the boulder is mostly split in half by a wide, grungy crack. A Theory of Gravity follows a line of bolts immediately left of the crack.

content.description: A boulder problem start leads to a great rest midway, then two bolts of really fun steep climbing, to an interesting redpoint crux guarding the anchors.
content.location: On the downhill side of the Sex Boulder. 2nd route from the right. Starts on a sidepull feature and cheater blocks.

content.description: Commute through a couple bolts of climbing and launch into brutal series of boulder problems with less than perfect shakes. Catch a great break at a ledge and smash an exciting sequence to the anchor. The Tantrum has the biggest holds you'll ever see on a face route this hard. A new-wave classic.
content.location: Facing the downhill side of the sex boulder, walk left up an occasionally muddy gully with a mossy boulder on the left. Front Butt climbs the arete on the downhill side, the Tantrum is the first independent route on the face. Miserable belay.

content.description: The Sex Boulder is a hulking, house-sized block of bullet hard sandstone on the right side of the corridor that leads to The Invasion Wall. A mix of lines exist, and each aspect of the boulder has a different character. The grey rock on the downhill side contains a number of powerful routes, including the classic 5.11d A Fool and His Honey, whereas the gorgeous, gold and black streaked southeast face contains a handful of hard, thin face climbs. The uphill side is home to some more obscure but quality lines and some new bolts. There are some boulder problems in the area as well that warrant a mention, including the ultra-classic rail problem Ab Lounge (V9).
